text: tonight is a hugely important night for
the Labour Party it's a night when we
can begin the process that is necessary
to heal the divisions in our party to
unite this party to make us into a a
truly powerful and united opposition and
get us ready once more to win back the
trust of the British people I get labour
back into government how on earth do you
begin to do that when it's very clear
that's waves of the membership think
that MPs like you do not have the right
to try to shove their leader out well I
want to say to all members the Labour
Party tonight young and old
long-standing new members I can be their
champion I am just as radical as Jeremy
Corbyn I think Jeremy is owed a debt of
gratitude for helping labour rediscover
its radical roots but we do need a new
generation of labour men and women to
take this party forward to get us ready
for government once more we've been on
the sidelines for too long what labour
members want is yes a principle of
leadership in this party but they want
someone who can put those principles
into practice by winning powerful labour
and looking after working people working
women working men the length and breadth
of Britain that's why I'm in politics
and that's what I intend to do but many
of those same members will say they have
someone like that who was chosen
overwhelmingly by them less than 12
months ago and we have now an
opportunity Jeremy and I to debate the
future of our party over this summer and
I pledge to all of those members that I
will do that in their comradely kind
gentle fashion that I think we need to
in the labour party but I will take
Jeremy on on the issues and on the
policies I think I've got ideas that can
turn some of the slogans we've had in
recent years into solution solutions
that would lead to better material
improvement in the lives of working
people that's what Labour's about we're
about helping people get on all people
in this country we've got to be seen as
that once more and under my leadership
we will be now some people would say
hearing you talk about kind and
comradely debate with jeremy corbyn
might not quite go along with what's
happened between you and i
egle in the last few days some of her
supporters feel that you rather have
behaved a little bit Shapley coming into
the race at the last minute and then
pushing her out essentially what you say
to that well I came into the race late
because my brother was ill as you know
when I was at his bedside in hospital
for several days but I've come into the
race full of ideas and full of energy I
just like to say to Angela who is a
great friend of mine and a wonderful
Labour leader who's been a pioneer in
our party for many years that I will
want to work side by side with Angela
throughout this contest I want Angela to
be at my right hand throats I need
Angela to work alongside me throughout
this contest and in the years that
follow it she is a great labour woman
and I absolutely cannot do without her
in what will be a very difficult few
months so if you can't do without her
have you offered her a job in your
campaign a position in your shadow
cabinet if you win well that's between
me and Angela but let me be as clear as
I possibly can be Angela is a star in
the labour firm and she will be at my
right hand throughout this contest
contest and if I am successful
thereafter Angela will be alongside me
as my right hand that sounds rather like
you've offered her the shadow
chancellorship or maybe the chair of
your company well it would be utterly
presumptive for me to get into that
we've got a contest between Jeremy and
myself right now but I couldn't be
clearer I want to build a team of all of
the talents of the Labour Party
we've been divided for far too long our
members a sick and tired of the Labour
Party being divided and it's my job
having been asked now by my peers to
heal the Labour Party to unite us they
get us ready not just to be an
opposition but a credible radical
government in Waiting that's what I'm
intending to do in over the next couple
of months I'm going to prove it to those
members street by street
town by town meeting by meeting I'm
gonna take the fight delt out of the
streets and make sure that I persuade
them but I can be not just the next
Labour leader but a Labour Prime
Minister in Waiting that is what I
intend to
to the country do you think you'll win
yes I do think I would I think I've got
the ideas and the energy and I think I
can persuade the labor membership that
it's time to move on from Jeremy it's
time for us to move on to a new
generation politicians and time for us
to get ready to be a government once
more the Tories are destroying many of
the things that Labour built over
decades they're being dismantled piece
by piece and labour cannot stand by on
the sidelines and let that happen
we have got to fight for our values and
to do that we've got to be powerful in
this place powerful in our communities
and credible the country has to look at
us and say we can imagine these people
running this country and doing so better
than the Conservatives that's the task
I'm setting myself that's the task I'm
setting everybody in labor and I expect
us to achieve it
